ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: ACTIVITIES :  HEALTH PROGRAMME Wet has conducted medical camps and supplied medical equipments to the hospitals. So far a total of 15000 people have benefitted through the medical camps. Besides 164 Chronic cases were referred to Government Hospitals. Apart from this, awareness on HIV/AIDS, Tuberculosis, Waterborne diseases have been conducted regularly.  AWARENESS ON ENVIRONMENT Village people were organized for de-silting tanks. Awareness programmes on tree plantation, usage of plastics, rain water harvesting, solid waste management, etc have been conducted by WET.  COACHING CLASS FOR CHILDREN A total of 120 poor children whose parents are not educated, children from 1st standard to 12th standard have been given special coaching in the evenings. As a result our students are obtaining good marks in the examinations.  OLD AGE HOME Women Empowerment Trust has been running Oldage Home Centre at Trichy providing food, shelter and medical facilities to the elderly persons.  SUPPLY OF MILCH ANIMALS Initially Milch animals were supplied to 10 women to the tune of Rupees One lakh, now they have been repaying on a revolving basis to be beneficial to other women. In that way till date 30 women have been benefitted till today.  MICRO CREDIT PROGRAMME Arrangements are made by WET for direct loans to SHG members. United Bank of India, Trichy-1, IOB, Chinthamani, Trichy-2 and Syndicate Bank, Koothur have been made to extend loans to SHGs. So far 30 poor women were given loans to the tune of Rupees Sixty Lakhs. All the women who obtained loan have been regularly repaying their dues.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The achievements are many folded. So far about two thousand students girls and boys from colleges and University on gender and legal aspects. Sustainable agriculture promotion done to enable three hundred farmers towards food security. One hundred students from Periyar Maniyammai school trained in English conversation program. Women and girl children from marginalized communtiies are empowered on their rights. A slum Level federation is formed and functioning.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Awareness creation among women and girl children on reproductive health rights. Formation of women forums done to facilitate the learning processes. Post natal and pre natal health awareness given. Educated the girl children to prevent early marriages. Provided support to education for girls and boys to enhance the performance in education.

Formation of Self Help Groups and linkages with Mahalir Thittam and Nationalized Banks for economic development. An Apex level Women Federation called Slum Level Federation was formed and linked with the Nationalised Bank and Silk Board for an economic development activity collectively by women. Awareness creation on social, gender and legal aspects provided to women. Rights to entitlements by linking to various government schemes to target communities done.

The project was implemented for enhancing the English coversation course as a foreign lanuage for the students of Periyar Maniyammai Girls Higher Secondary School in Tiruchirapalli city. Around 100 children are trained after school hours in English.

Around 50 SHGs are formed and linked with the Nationalized Banks for economic development. District level lobbying with various departments undertaken for linking with different schemes of the government. Awareness to girl children to prevent early marriages done.
Provided free food distribution to vulnerable communities seasonally

Awareness creation among girl children in schools and colleges on gender analysis and the Criminal law amendment Act 2013 to curb sexual harassment. Around 180 women and girl children from schools, colleges, police and NGOS are trained.

The English language is taught as a foreign lanuage to girl children studying at Periyar Maniyammai Girls Higher secondary school, Tiruchirapalli after school hours. Around 100 children are trained every day after school hours.

The Muslim womens issues are dealt by the Mosque Committees. Often the women are not consulted for resolving the marial issues and get divorced unilaterally. Therefore the Mosque committees are sensitized on gender issues to bring about changes in attitude knowledge and skills to address the womens issues. A series of workshops are conducted towards it.

A series of training on Gender analysis and Criminal law amendment Act 2013 was imparted to girls in schools and colleges, women police and NGOs to empower them to stop sexual harassment against them.
School bags are procured and distributed to school children from vulnerable communities.

Sustainable agriculture practices are promoted among dryland farmer women in 5 villages of Viralimalai block in Pudukottai district. Kitchen gardening prmoted among 132 women towards their food and nutritional security. Minor millets, pulses are promoted. Milch animals are procured and supplied to enhance additional income generation.

Self Help Groups and the Slum level Federation are strengthened through series of trainings and meetings. The Slum Level Federation members are facilitated to access to government schemes through lobbying at district and state level.
Seasonal food programme distributed food pockets to 5000 families in 20 habitations of Tiruchirapalli district among the vulnerable families.
Around 100 children studying at Periyar Maniyammai Girls Higher Secondary school Tiruchirapalli were trained on English language as a foreign language after school hours.

A worskhop on stakeholder concerted actions to stop sexual harassment was conducted with the participants of the trainings imparted to girls and women from schools colleges police and NGOS. Further follow up actions evolved.
Around 5000 food pockets are distributed to vulnerable families who do not have three meals per day in Manaparai taluk. This was implemented in 20 villages.

Sustainable agriculture practices are promoted among dryland farmers women in 5 habitations. Kitchen gardening has been successful in reaching the food and nutritional requirements. Minor millets pulses fodder crops are promoted which helped the farmers to cope up with the drought situation. Seed banks provided timely inputs to agriculture.

The assertion of the rights of women and girl children are ensured through formation of Forums. Awareness generation to prevent early marriages done for girl children. The womens issues are addressed by creation of bare foot counselors. The children are enabled to have space and motivation to study through Child Activity centres. The out of school children are mainstreamed back to school.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: 1100 women self groups have been formed. A sum of Rs. 40.05crores has been disbursed as loans to 900 SHGs. ngoList.title: WORLD HUMAN RIGHTS COMMISSION AND RESCUE CENTRE
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Marathon held as part of promoting human rights awareness Chennai, Dec 9, 2017 (PTI) A marathon was held here today as part of promoting awareness on human rights. About 1,500 RPT 1,500 persons participated in the Unity Run Marathon on the eve of World Human Rights Day, celebrated on December 10 every year the organisers said in a release. Vijesh K Garg, VSM, Deputy Director General, NCC Directorate, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Andaman and senior officials from CISF flagged off the event.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The WHRC started in the year 2007 and have worked considerably towards achieving its goals to spread awareness among General Public by conducting various Conferences, Marathon rallies and Press Meetings. To keep up with its strong ideals with latest and updated information of all communities in the society, WHRC has written letters to the various Schools, Colleges, Government

WHRC Law Journals carry news and articles relating to the rights of an individual as envisaged under their Constitution and the various articles on the Protection of Human Rights including Geneva Conventions and reporting of events across the World. WHRC has been voicing against all fundamental rights caused to any citizen or the violation of human rights

To educate them about their Lawful rights as has been enshrined in their Constitution and also in various acts promulgated by the legislators and various rulings passed by the Honble Courts and other judicial forums in Our World
WHRC regularly publishes duly registered law journals titled World Human Rights Commission and Rescue Center (WHRC) Report Regd. No. TNENG/2008/27643 (English)
